description: The unique cluster identifier. This is the vcenter cluster ID
name: cluster-id

description: The vCenter Server username. You must specify the username along with the domain name. For example, user = 'Administrator@vsphere.local' or user = 'vsphere.local\Administrator'.
name: vcenter-username

description: Password for a vCenter Server user
name: vcenter-password

description: vCenter Server port. The default is 443
name: port

description: Takes the following values: 1. 'true' indicates that you want to use self-signed certificate for login. 2. 'false' indicates that you use secure connection.
name: insecure-flag

description: vCenter host - The vCenter server ip
name: host

description: List of all comma separated datacenter paths where host VMs are present. Provide the name of the datacenter when it is located at the root. When it is placed in the folder, you need to specify the path as folder/datacenter-name. The datacenter name cannot contain a comma since it is used as a delimiter
name: datacenters

description: The path to a CA certificate in xxxxx.pem format. This is an optional parameter
name: ca-file

description: The certificate thumbprint. It is an optional parameter. It is ignored when you are using an unsecured setup or when you provide ca-file
name: thumbprint
